rComments: Professor Hinck was difficult. I earned an A in her class, but I had to work for it. She presents the material fairly clearly, and is inspiring in her presentation of the material. She really loves what she does. Her tests were the hardest I've had as an MCD major, but if you stay on top of her lectures and study as you go, it's doable.

Professor Hinck is a wonderful teacher. She presents the material in a very clear way. After taking the class I am able to easily read science papers and engage in thoughtful conversations with grad students and PI's because of what I learned in cell biology. Many people complain about all the material, but if you put in the work, you will be fine.

Her lectures are really engaging and you can see how much she cares about the topics she teaches about. Go to office hours, super helpful and interactive, be up-to-date with the material to really benefit from it. Her tests are challenging but very doable if you study to understand rather than to memorize. Put in the work and this class is great :)
Lindsay Hinck is a great professor. She cares about students but can seem unapproachable at times. Exams are tough but doable.

Lindsay isn't very approachable - she wants students to learn but will then speak to you as if you were an idiot for asking questions. She can be extremely rude at times and talks down to students. She is very knowledgable in the subject, but has poor people skills. I amazed she has made it this far in her career with her bad additude.

Professor Hinck is a remarkable professor who cares deeply about her students and works to help them succeed in the world. Her lectures are engaging and although her classes are tough, she's willing to help students who put effort into her class.

Professor Hinck was my instructor for the health sciences internship seminar. Her lectures were very informative and entertaining, and reflected a sincere love of teaching. She expects a lot from her students, but provides honest feedback and outstanding constructive criticism. She's an awesome editor, and truly cares about her students.

I had Dr. Hinck for Bio189 and Biol110. Her lectures are extremely enjoyable because of her enthusiasm for the subject. Her tests are hard because she wants you apply what you learned. For Bio189 she truly wants you to take away research skills. Attend her office hours because she does show genuine interest in her students' success.

I was very fortunate to have Professor Hinck for BIO189. Class discussions were engaging and mind-opening. Hinck expects high-quality work from her students and will help you succeed if you put in the effort. Make sure you talk to her in office hours! Hinck is not only a brilliant professor, but also personable and funny.

I had Dr. Hinck for the health internship course, and I feel so lucky to have gotten the chance to know her. Definitely the most direct academic mentor that I've had. If you take one of her classes try to build a relationship with her, she is someone who will be a benefit to you.

Cell bio with Hinck is probably one of the only challenging classes for MCD majors. Having been accepted to medical school, I can say her testing style actually challenges you and helps prepare you for tests like the MCAT. It is more than just memorization. Prof Hinck makes herself available to help and appreciates students who work hard.

I took Prof Hinck's Health Sciences Internship class. After I got feedback on my poorly-drafted research paper, I took it as a wake-up call and a challenge. My hard work and my positive attitude helped me gain a brilliant mentor, who provided constructive feedback. She expects excellence and cares very much about her students. I enjoyed her class.
Very helpful outside of class.   Very knowledgable
Loved the class and professor. Class was really difficult because there's so much to learn, but her enthusiasm and teaching makes cell a great subject.

She is a very entertaining professor and loves to make her students laugh (just to keep her students awake). If you just read/know/understand her notes, practice doing the problems, and do the practice tests, then you should be pass the class. Overall, a good teacher!!

Hinck is awesome. She is very enthusiastic about the subject matter as well as students' understanding of it. Not an easy class, but if you go to lecture and keep up with the class you will be fine. Without a doubt one of the funnest, most interesting biology classes you will take. Cheers!

I found this class really interesting, and I really enjoyed all the extra information that Prof. Hinckpresented.  This is definitely not a class you can pass by just reading the book.  Come to class!  I thought Prof. Hinck's teaching style really emphasized understanding as opposed to memorization.  Highly recommend this class with Prof. Hinck!

Cell Biology is the hardest upperdivison class I have taken so far, I felt is was pretty much complete memorization. Hinck is not a terrible professors but the subject matter is laborious and her multiple choice questions are challenging. Memorize every detail from her lecture notes and just pray for the best!

Dr. Hinck brings an extraordinary passion to her work. As others have said, she tough but fair. If you're interested and prepared to work hard, you'll do well. She genuinely appreciates students who engage with the material and will go to great lengths to support them. Her energy and, let's face it, hotness (hey, the site asked) are a bonus.

Lindsay is a very entertaining lecturer. I still found myself dozing off on occasion (who wouldn't in cell bio?), but she's very entertaining, funny, and passionate. My only complaint is her tests questions are usually very ambiguous or confusing.

dont bother coming to class, her lectures are posted via podcast (super niceee). the tests include applying what u know and some basic knowledge questions.final is not cummaltive(sweeet)no need to attend discussion-her tests can be challenging and she expects you to understand how interpret experimental data,shes helpful in what she wants u to know
Prof. Hinck is a fantastic lecturer - she is clear and impassioned about the science. Great Class! Enjoy!

This is my favorite class I have ever taken at UCSC... That said this is also the hardest class I have ever taken as well.  Hinck is a clear teacher but the tests are ridiculous excpect to put in 50+ hours of study time if you want a decent grade

Dr. Hinck is very knowledgeable, passionate, and inspirational to lots of people.  She is also chaotic, often irrational, and one of the worst test-writers i've ever encountered.  If you want a fun class, that's easy to stay awake for --> she's for you.  If you want a comprehensive, educational class --> read a book instead.

Dr. Hinck is one of the best profs on campus. People like to put her down because she  breaks from the norm, but she really is the best prof. She's hilarious, helpful and quite fair on her exams. GO TO OFFICE HOURS! She doesn't talk about her research all that much, which is too bad b/c she does the coolest stuff on campus.

She is a really intimidating professor, she is flipping scary. But she teaches very well, is very entertaining and if you get to know her in her office hours and she sees you work, she will reward you. Gives grades based on improvement if talk to her.

Lindsay is probably one of the best biology professors at UCSC. It is definitely possible to get an A if you give your time into this class. Study her notes, the book can be used as a reference, but it was not that helpful to me. I went to her office hours almost every week. I wanted to get to know her, but she didn't give me a chance to do that.
would definitely recommend taking it with her! face it, no matter who you take this class with, it's gonna be hard.

Lindsay is the most extraordinary professor at UCSC.  Her class was well structured and her teaching method greatly helped me remember and understand the massive amount of material covered. The course is very difficult but she gives you every tool you need to do well in the class.

She is an excellent mentor and a very motivational lecturer. While her standards are high, as long as your are self-motivated and interested in science you will undoubtedly succeed in her class. You should expect to be challenged but be appreciative of the fact that she has high expectations for her students.

FIRST: If you're easily offended, she's abrasive. Yet she keeps her lectures lively and seemed geniunely interested in us. Cellbio is fast-paced and a lot of material; her notes provide the level of detail and breadth she requires. Exams were very difficult, but in retrospect, they were fair. Hinck made it one of my favorite classes in bio classes!

A good professor, tho not always as on-target as she expects of students. The first test was sloppy and inaccurate in certain parts (i.e. tell me one thing, then took off points for not naming when she hadn't asked for names in the first place). Not easy to get to know, can have rather a harsh nature. But she does really want students to learn.
She enforces a sort of "tough love"... she wants what is best for her students and wants them to excel as much as they can. I learned more from her than any other teacher.

Despite of the last comment....that was a lie I've attended every class and that never happened. This proffesor has been great and needs to be appreciated as one of the few women proffesor in the Biological Sciences at UCSC. She's PoSitiVe and always reviews the previous lecture before she begins new material that Day! That's Beautiful & Helpful

She seems very personable and fun at first, but office hours are different. She blew up at me saying the rest of the class were basically idiots and i was too, since i asked her questions. She only likes certain people, who put up with her bad attitude. Test questions are too broad to have very specific answers.
Lindsay will make you think and work hard (that is why you are in school right?) but she is also very willing to spend extra time with you if you need help.  An enthusiastic teacher!
If you study from her notes you should be fine!!!!
Excellent class, very informative instructor.

This was a hard class. It's a complicated difficult subject. I appreciated taking it from a professor who is obviously passionate about her work and communicates her passion to the class. She's tough, but I think that's because she genuinely wants to make sure we understand the material. (Can't beleive no one else thinks she's hot!).

Lindsay is not the unreasonable person many of the above students say she is. If you get to know her better, out side of class, you will see that she is a true individual. From her style of lecturing, you can tell that she loves the atmospere of the class room. As far as exams go, if prepared, you will be fine. Lindsay is a great person.

Lectures were funny and moved along at an easy pace so not hard to keep up and she talked to us like we were peers or colleagues or something - I never slept once! - but I totally had to study to do good on tests (alot easier than o-chem though).  I went to office hours twice and she was totally sweet.  Cool class overall!

Worst professor I encountered in the MCD dept. Not approachable and disrespectful in my opinion.  Exams are hard and test on detail information (would prefer pictures over writing).  Handwriting are sloppy and unreadable.  I would recommend taking cell bio with Kellogg instead.

As a person she's nice. But, she is not very good at lecturing. Her tests touch on a little of everything. And yes she does like pictures. She also likes to have very specific instructions on questions so always read them

she wasnt the best professor for this topic..but if you do take her for cell bio..DRAW PICTURES...i ended up doing pretty well..dont bother with the book either..just do the figures and read her notes
would not recommend taking it with her.
No Comments
